title: Job Vacancies at PricewaterhouseCoopers
content:
PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) Nigeria has been operating in Nigeria since 1953 through its predecessor firms of Coopers & Lybrand and Price Waterhouse. We're one of the leading professional services firms in the country with offices in Lagos, Abuja and Port Harcourt, over 1000 staff and 31 resident partners.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Business Information Security Officer (BISO) 

Job ID: 667362WD
Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary 
     

            
    




	Those in information security at PwC will focus on protecting sensitive data and systems from cyber threats through risk assessments, security audits, and implementing robust security measures.
	Your work will help enable the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information assets for clients.
	PwC is driving major changes across information and cyber security by building a centralized model to provide security services across the entire network of member firms.  Mandated at the network level, Network Information Security (NIS) operates outside Information Technology (IT) and is responsible for this major program initiative, from definition of the security strategy to the execution of the global Cyber Readiness Program, moving from local to globally provided services.
	Our mission is to identify, control, and reduce the attack surface across the network of member firms while increasing our adversaries’ cost of attack.
	NIS is redefining cyber security on a global scale at PwC. Our mission protects 223,000 PwC members across 157 member firms worldwide, as well as our global clients.
	If you are seeking an exciting career with the scope to grow your cyber security skills through major change on a global scale, then NIS will empower you to do so.


What does your work look like?


	This role is part of the Central and Eastern Europe (CEE) Chief Information Security Office (CISO) team.  CEE CISO team enables local and CEE regional security effectiveness and helps remove roadblocks and barriers from Cyber Readiness Program journey.
	The role focuses on supporting local implementation and delivery of NIS services, handling business compliance activities, assisting with security assessments, and working closely with regional and global teams on security matters. It involves hands-on operational security tasks, governance, risk management, and stakeholder engagement at the local and regional level.
	You will typically operate as a strategic liaison between the business and security teams, focusing more on translating business requirements into security initiatives and often operates at a more senior leadership level with broader accountability over business unit security posture.


Your skills and responsibilities include but are not limited to:


	Support local implementation and delivery of NIS services and BAU activities.
	Ensure compliance with Nigeria Data Protection Regulation (NDPR) in all data handling activities.
	Monitor and report on compliance with Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) guidelines.
	Assist business teams with navigating Nigeria-specific security assessment and approval processes.
	Collaborate with global NIS service teams on matters impacting PwC Nigeria.
	Translate technical data into digestible formats for Nigerian business teams (e.g., dashboards, reports).
	Coordinate with Nigerian regulators and industry bodies on cybersecurity matters.


Regulatory Compliance


	Adhere to NDPR requirements for data privacy and protection.
	Align role responsibilities with SEC compliance standards.
	Ensure local content development and licensing requirements are met.


Who are you?


	High level understanding of professional services industry business model, service offerings, and threat landscapes
	Aligning technical and the business world – ability to influence
	Interest in Information Security and a broad understanding of its ability to act as a differentiator in the market
	Solid understanding of technical information security risks in all of its facets
	Inquisitive nature and intuition regarding what questions to ask, when, and their relative significance.
	Creative problem solving and strong communication skills.
	Possess a growth mindset and be able to adapt to operate in different environments.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in cybersecurity or information security roles.
	Familiarity with NDPR, SEC regulations, and Nigeria’s IT governance frameworks.
	Relevant certifications (e.g., CISM, CISSP, NDPR compliance training) are preferred


Application Closing Date: 8th February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Brand Management, Bid & Proposal Associate

Reference Number: 694430WD
Job Location: Lagos

Job Description & Summary


	At PwC, we’re looking for innovative and driven professionals to join our Brand Management, Bid & Proposal Management team.
	In this role, you’ll collaborate with talented colleagues to design and deliver strategic sales and marketing initiatives that fuel revenue growth, elevate our brand, and open doors to new business opportunities.
	You’ll harness market insights, digital marketing, creative campaigns, and cutting-edge sales strategies to engage clients and strengthen PwC’s market presence.
	As part of our Proposal Strategy team, you’ll be at the heart of our most important client pursuits.
	Your mission? To craft compelling proposals and pitches that clearly communicate ideas, solutions, and value propositions to private clients, government agencies, NGOs, and international institutions. You’ll provide end-to-end pursuit coaching, apply PwC’s BXT (Business, Experience, Technology) methodology, manage bids, evaluate proposals, and ensure every submission is polished and persuasive.
	If you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and want to help position PwC for success on a global stage, this is your opportunity to make an impact.
	Driven by curiosity, you are a reliable, contributing member of a team. In our fast-paced environment, you are expected to adapt to working with a variety of clients and team members, each presenting varying challenges and scope.Every experience is an opportunity to learn and grow. You are expected to take ownership and consistently deliver quality work that drives value for our clients and success as a team As you navigate through the Firm, you build a brand for yourself, opening doors to more opportunities.


Role Summary


	We’re looking for a strategic and detail-oriented professional to support our Pursuit and Proposals function within the Clients and Market Development unit.
	In this role, you’ll collaborate across service lines to develop compelling proposals and pitches that position our firm for success with private clients, government agencies, NGOs, and international institutions.


Summary of Key Responsibilities


	Co-create and implement pursuit strategies that align with the firm’s growth objectives.
	Write, review, and edit proposal content to ensure clarity, compliance, and persuasiveness.
	Work closely with client teams to define proposal win-themes and strategies.
	Conduct market and competitor analysis to inform proposal approaches and continuously improve processes.
	Maintain brand standards and accuracy across all proposal documents.
	Manage a central repository of proposals and promote best practices in proposal management.
	Train and raise awareness of pursuit and proposal tools within the firm.


Required Experience and Capabilities


	A bachelor’s degree (Second Class Upper) in any discipline.
	Minimum 3 years of experience in proposal writing and bid management.
	APMP certification is an advantage.
	Experience in public sector bidding.
	Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint, Word, and Excel.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills.
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines


Travel Requirements:


	Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?.


Application Closing Date: 27th February, 2026.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Chief Executive Officer

Reference Number:130-PEO01322
Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	We are seeking a visionary Chief Executive Officer (CEO) to lead the next phase of strategic growth and transformation.


Responsibilities


	Drive the organisation’s mission to deliver on its accessibility, affordability, availability, and awareness mandate, positioning the bank as Africa’s leading provider of inclusive digital payment solutions.
	Spearhead the development and deployment of transformative digital banking technologies, including the organisation’s patented phone-number-based payment system, to deepen financial inclusion and expand market reach.
	Lead commercial strategies that grow the mobile money ecosystem, enhance customer acquisition, and scale agent and subscriber networks across Nigeria.
	Build and nurture high-impact relationships with regulators (e.g., CBN), fintechs, telcos, and community agents to accelerate adoption and influence sector-wide innovation.
	Oversee governance, risk management, and compliance frameworks that support sustainable growth, profitability, and regulatory alignment.
	Lead the expansion of distribution infrastructure and marketing strategies to grow the bank’s digital and fintech footprint, especially in underserved and remote communities.
	Inspire and enable the executive team to deliver on strategic priorities with excellence, accountability, and a culture of innovation.
	Lead digital transformation initiatives that enhance stakeholder experience, build resilience, and position the bank for long-term success.


Qualifications


	A degree in a finance/business related discipline from a reputable institution.
	An MBA or Masters’ degree in any finance/business related discipline is an added advantage.
	Professional certification or membership of reputable Institutions (e.g., CIBN, IoD).
	Proven C-suite leadership and significant experience in financial technology and banking.
	Exceptional strategic thinking, stakeholder management, and change leadership abilities
	Passion for innovation, market development, and business expansion.
	Highly adaptive leadership attributes.


Why Join?
The opportunity to join this institution is both compelling and inspiring, offering a unique platform to:


	Lead a digital-first bank that is transforming financial access for millions of Nigerians, especially the unbanked, through innovative mobile-based banking solutions.
	Shape the future of Nigeria’s payment ecosystem by leveraging cutting-edge technology, strategic partnerships, and a unique phone-number-based payment model.
	Collaborate with regulators, FinTechs, and community agents to deliver sustainable growth while enjoying the freedom to chart bold, visionary strategies in a high-impact leadership role.


Application Closing Date: 12th January, 2026.

Click here to apply online

Data Center Critical Facilities Engineer Job at Equinix




        
    

        
        Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 260 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Center Critical Facilities Engineer 
Job ID:  JR-155635
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Summary


	Applies acquired job skills to work on tasks that are semi-routine in nature.
	Focus is on semi-routine tasks within standard operating procedures.
	Supports the overall team.


Responsibilities
Facility/Infrastructure Maintenance:


	Performs semi-routine preventative maintence checks on-site to non-critical, facility components.
	Performs semi-routine repairs, maintenance and installations to non-critical facility components.
	Monitors the Builiding Monitoring System (BMS) and responds timely to semi-routine alarms according to standard operating procedures.
	Assists more senior staff in higher facility repairs and corrective maintenance measures.
	Operates plumbing, fire suppression, and safety systems, under the supervision of more senior technical staff.
	Normally follows established procedures on routine work, requires instructions only on new assignments.


Vendor Support:


	Coordinates with vendors to ensure maintenance activities are carried out as per Equinix's requirements.
	Supports the work order approval process for service providers on routine maintenance work, for tracking: briefing at the start of work, work during the day workday/shift and final review of the work carried out.
	Ensures vendor maintenance activities are carried out as per Equinix's standard operating procedures.


Site Administration & Incident Support:


	Performs semi-routine site logs for permits, such as Maintenance Operation Protocol (MOPs) and scripts.
	Uses acquired job skills in following operating procedures to support on-site administration.


Work Orders & Additional Projects:


	Completes semi-routine work requests and circuit installations.
	Follows established procedures with troubleshooting and maintaining office equipment (if necessary); supports auxiliary equipment and machines.
	Assists more senior staff with responding on-site incidents and acts as directed.


Collaboration:


	Collaborates with others to resolve semi-routine facility incidents.
	Provides assistance to more senior staff on infrastructure projects.
	Informs stakeholders of inventory needs to maintain stock levels of parts and equipment.


Qualifications


	Electrical and Electronics Engineering or related degree required
	1-4 years of equivalent work experience.

Procurement Associate Job at People2profit Nigeria




        
    

        
        People2profit Nigeria - Our client, a vibrant and customer-centric retail brand, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Associate

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Mode of work: Onsite

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are in their search for a sharp, proactive Procurement Associate. This is a unique opportunity to join a creative, fast-moving team that values data, market insight, and seamless product delivery.
	In this role you’ll report directly to the Creative Director and collaborate closely with marketing, operations, and customer service teams to align product offerings with market demand.


Key Responsibilities


	Forecast product demand using sales data, customer feedback, and market trends.
	Plan and manage product ranges, stock levels, and inventory cycles
	Identify, vet, and build lasting relationships with local and international suppliers and manufacturers.
	Conduct ongoing market research to discover trending, high-potential products.
	Negotiate cost-effective pricing, shipping terms, and delivery timelines.
	Monitor stock movement and recommend promotions, markdowns, or clearance strategies to optimize turnover.
	Maintain an updated and reliable supplier and product database.
	Support marketing initiatives including content creation, campaign development, and order fulfillment.
	Deliver regular insights to leadership on customer preferences, competitor activity, and new product opportunities.


Qualifications/Requirements


	HND/Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field. with 3-5 years of experience in procurement, retail buying, inventory planning, or supply chain
	Strong analytical and research skills—you’re comfortable interpreting sales reports and market signals.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal abilities
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets and standard office productivity tools.
	A genuine interest in retail, consumer behavior, and product curation.


Why Join our Client?


	Competitive compensation (N250,000 – N300,000/month) and room for professional development.Be part of a nimble, creative, and growth-focused retail brand redefining customer experience in Nigeria.
	Direct influence on product selection and business strategy from day one.
	A collaborative culture that rewards initiative, accuracy, and innovation.
	Opportunity to grow into broader roles in supply chain, operations, or brand management.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@people2profit.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Proximity to Lekki area of Lagos is added advantage.
